class="excerpt"><div class="rm-Markdown markdown-body" data-testid="RDMD"><p>Make your first request to the Notion API.</p></div></div></div><div class="col-xs-3"><a class="SuggestEdituoSX2zdYKItO class="grid-container-fluid" id="content-container"><section class="content-body grid-75 "><div dehydrated="&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;integration-overview&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-integration-overview&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Integration overview&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Integration overview&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#integration-overview&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In this guide, we‚Äôre going to build an &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/getting-started#internal-integrations&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;internal Notion integration&lt;/a&gt; that can create a new database in your Notion workspace via a web form.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;figure&gt;&lt;span aria-label=&quot;Demo web app that creates new databases in your Notion workspace.&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;Demo web app that creates new databases in your Notion workspace.&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/55d7b4b-dbform.png&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;border&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;figcaption&gt;&lt;p&gt;Demo web app that creates new databases in your Notion workspace.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/figcaption&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Internal integrations are a good entry point to building integrations because they have a simpler &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;authorization&lt;/a&gt; flow than &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/getting-started#public-integrations&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;public integrations&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Before diving in, let‚Äôs quickly review Notion integrations. Integrations define how the public API can programmatically interact with your Notion workspace. They need to be authorized (i.e., given explicit permission) to make any changes your workspace.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;All integration types use Notion‚Äôs public API to make requests to update a Notion workspace. The specific use case for each integration can vary greatly, from using Notion as a CMS for a blog, to &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/notion-github-sync&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;tracking Github issues&lt;/a&gt;, to &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/database-email-update&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;sending emails&lt;/a&gt; in response to Notion changes.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This guide is just one introductory example of what you can build with Notion‚Äôs public API.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;todays-goals&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-todays-goals&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Today‚Äôs goals&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Today‚Äôs goals&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#todays-goals&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This guide will demonstrate how to build an HTML form that will &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;create a new Notion database&lt;/a&gt; when submitted.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;By the end of this guide, we‚Äôll have a functional app that looks like this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;figure&gt;&lt;span aria-label=&quot;Database form UI.&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;Database form UI.&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/36a22d6-dbform.png&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;border&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;figcaption&gt;&lt;p&gt;Database form UI.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/figcaption&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The completed &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/web-form-with-express&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;sample code&lt;/a&gt; includes additional examples beyond what‚Äôs covered in this guide, including forms to:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Add a new page&lt;/a&gt; to the database&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/patch-block-children&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Add content&lt;/a&gt; to the new page&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-comment&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Add a comment&lt;/a&gt; to the page content&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;requirements&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-requirements&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Requirements&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Requirements&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#requirements&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To follow along with this guide, you will need:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A¬†&lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/signup&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion account&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;To be a &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/help/add-members-admins-guests-and-groups&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Workspace Owner&lt;/a&gt;¬†in the workspace you‚Äôre using. You can create a new workspace for testing purposes otherwise.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Knowledge of HTML and JavaScript. We‚Äôll use &lt;a href=&quot;https://expressjs.com/&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Express.js&lt;/a&gt; for a server, as well.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.npmjs.com/downloading-and-installing-node-js-and-npm&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;npm and Node.js&lt;/a&gt;¬†installed locally to use the¬†&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://expressjs.com/&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Express.js&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;blockquote class=&quot;callout callout_info&quot; theme=&quot;üìò&quot;&gt;&lt;h2 class=&quot;callout-heading&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;callout-icon&quot;&gt;üìò&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;SDK usage is recommended, but not required&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/web-form-with-express&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;sample code&lt;/a&gt; shown below uses the &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt; to make Notion API requests.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Using the SDK for JavaScript is not required to build a Notion integration, but many JavaScript &amp;amp; TypeScript developers prefer it due to its ease of use.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;getting-started&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-getting-started&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Getting started&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Getting started&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#getting-started&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;create-your-integration-in-notion&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-create-your-integration-in-notion&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Create your integration in Notion&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Create your integration in Notion&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#create-your-integration-in-notion&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The first step to building any integration (internal or public) is to create a new integration in Notion‚Äôs integrations dashboard: &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/profile/integrations&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;https://www.notion.com/my-integrations&amp;gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Click &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;+ New integration&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
&lt;span aria-label=&quot;&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/402cf3d-new_integrations_1.png&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;ol start=&quot;2&quot;&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Enter the integration name and select the associated workspace for the new integration.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
&lt;span aria-label=&quot;&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/aef3bab-new_integrations_2.png&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;get-your-api-secret&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-get-your-api-secret&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Get your API secret&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Get your API secret&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#get-your-api-secret&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;API requests require an API secret to be successfully authenticated. Visit the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;Configuration&lt;/code&gt; tab to get your integration‚Äôs API secret (or ‚ÄúInternal Integration Secret‚Äù).&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;span aria-label=&quot;&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/7ec836a-integrations_3.png&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;blockquote class=&quot;callout callout_okay&quot; theme=&quot;üëç&quot;&gt;&lt;h2 class=&quot;callout-heading&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;callout-icon&quot;&gt;üëç&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;Keep your API secret a secret!&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;Any value used to authenticate API requests should always be kept secret. Use environment variables and avoid committing sensitive data to your version control history.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;If you do accidentally expose it, remember to ‚Äúrefresh‚Äù your secret.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;give-your-integration-page-permissions&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-give-your-integration-page-permissions&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Give your integration page permissions&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Give your integration page permissions&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#give-your-integration-page-permissions&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The database that we‚Äôre about to create will be added to a parent Notion page in your workspace. For your integration to interact with the page, it needs explicit permission to read/write to that specific Notion page.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To give the integration permission, you will need to:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Pick (or create) a Notion page.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Click on the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;...&lt;/code&gt; More menu in the top-right corner of the page.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Scroll down to &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;+ Add Connections&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Search for your integration and select it.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Confirm the integration can access the page and all of its child pages.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
&lt;figure&gt;&lt;span aria-label=&quot;Give your integration permission to add a database to a page.&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;Give your integration permission to add a database to a page.&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/fefc809-permissions.gif&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;border&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;figcaption&gt;&lt;p&gt;Give your integration permission to add a database to a page.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/figcaption&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Your integration can now make API requests related to this Notion page and any of its children.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;If you are building a public integration, use the authorization instructions included in the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization#public-integration-auth-flow-set-up&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Authorization guide&lt;/a&gt; instead.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote class=&quot;callout callout_warn&quot; theme=&quot;üöß&quot;&gt;&lt;h2 class=&quot;callout-heading&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;callout-icon&quot;&gt;üöß&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;Double-check your page access&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;If your API requests are failing, confirm you have given the integration permission to the page you are trying to update. This is a common cause of API request errors.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;hr/&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;setting-up-the-demo-locally&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-setting-up-the-demo-locally&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Setting up the demo locally&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Setting up the demo locally&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#setting-up-the-demo-locally&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In this example, we‚Äôll have three key files:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;index.html&lt;/code&gt;, which will contain our client-side markdown (HTML).&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;client.js&lt;/code&gt;, which will contain our client-side JavaScript code.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.js&lt;/code&gt;, which will contain our server-side JavaScript code. This file contains all the endpoints to make requests to Notion‚Äôs public API, as well as to serve the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;index.html&lt;/code&gt; file. (&lt;a href=&quot;#step-3-importing-the-notion-sdk-serverjs&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;More on that below.&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;p&gt;All of the sample code is available in &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/web-form-with-express&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;GitHub&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote class=&quot;callout callout_info&quot; theme=&quot;üìò&quot;&gt;&lt;h2 class=&quot;callout-heading&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;callout-icon&quot;&gt;üìò&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;Various examples are available&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;This integration includes frontend code, but integrations can be server-side only as well. See more examples of different integration use cases in &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;GitHub&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;clone-demo-repo&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-clone-demo-repo&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Clone demo repo&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Clone demo repo&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#clone-demo-repo&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To run this project locally, clone the repo and install its dependencies (&lt;a href=&quot;https://expressjs.com/en/starter/installing.html&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Express.js&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.npmjs.com/package/dotenv&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;dotenv&lt;/a&gt;, and &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion‚Äôs SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt;):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;Shell&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-shell theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;shell&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;# Clone this repository locally
git clone https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js.git

# Switch into this project
cd notion-sdk-js/examples/web-form-with-express/

# Install the dependencies
npm install
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;environment-variables&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-environment-variables&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Environment variables&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Environment variables&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#environment-variables&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In your &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;.env&lt;/code&gt; file, add the following variables:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;.env&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-shell theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;shell&quot; name=&quot;.env&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;NOTION_KEY=&amp;lt;your-notion-api-key&amp;gt;
NOTION_PAGE_ID=&amp;lt;parent-page-id&amp;gt;
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Add the API secret you retrieved in &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;Getting Started&lt;/code&gt; to &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;NOTION_KEY&lt;/code&gt;, as well as a page ID (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;NOTION_PAGE_ID&lt;/code&gt;) for the page that you gave the integration permission to update.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote class=&quot;callout callout_okay&quot; theme=&quot;üëç&quot;&gt;&lt;h2 class=&quot;callout-heading&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;callout-icon&quot;&gt;üëç&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;How database IDs work&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;When using the API to &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;create a database&lt;/a&gt;, the parent of a database must be a Notion page or a &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/help/wikis-and-verified-pages&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;wiki&lt;/a&gt; database. To get the ID of the page, locate the 32-character string at the end of the page‚Äôs URL.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;span aria-label=&quot;The page ID is highlighted.&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;The page ID is highlighted.&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/7e8a54d-notion-page-url.png&quot; align=&quot;&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; title=&quot;&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;As a best practice, add &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;.env&lt;/code&gt; to your &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;.gitignore&lt;/code&gt; file to ensure you don‚Äôt accidentally share these personalized values.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;running-the-project-locally&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-running-the-project-locally&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Running the project locally&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Running the project locally&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#running-the-project-locally&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To run this project locally, you will need to enter the following command in your terminal:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;Shell&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-shell theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;shell&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;npm start
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Next, let‚Äôs look at how our database form works.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;hr/&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;creating-a-new-database&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-creating-a-new-database&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Creating a new database&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Creating a new database&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#creating-a-new-database&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;step-1-adding-a-database-form-indexhtml&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-step-1-adding-a-database-form-index-html&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Step 1: Adding a database form (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;index.html&lt;/code&gt;)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Step 1: Adding a database form (&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#step-1-adding-a-database-form-indexhtml&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In our &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;index.html&lt;/code&gt; file, we need a form for the user to create a new database and an area for the API response to be displayed. This is how the user will initiate a public API request.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;figure&gt;&lt;span aria-label=&quot;App design for creating a database.&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;App design for creating a database.&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/76077fd-new_database.png&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;border&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;figcaption&gt;&lt;p&gt;App design for creating a database.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/figcaption&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;
&lt;figure&gt;&lt;span aria-label=&quot;Rendered app design for creating a database.&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;Rendered app design for creating a database.&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/c73de3e-dbform.png&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;border&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;figcaption&gt;&lt;p&gt;Rendered app design for creating a database.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/figcaption&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The corresponding &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/blob/main/examples/web-form-with-express/views/index.html#L40&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;HTML elements&lt;/a&gt; related to creating a database are shown below:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;HTML&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-html theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;html&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;!DOCTYPE html&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;html lang=&amp;quot;en&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;head&amp;gt;
    ...
&amp;lt;!-- Import the webpage&amp;#x27;s stylesheet --&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;link rel=&amp;quot;stylesheet&amp;quot; href=&amp;quot;/style.css&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;

&amp;lt;!-- Import the webpage&amp;#x27;s client-side javascript file --&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;script src=&amp;quot;/client.js&amp;quot; defer&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/script&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;/head&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;body&amp;gt;
    ...
      &amp;lt;table&amp;gt;
        ...
        &amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;td&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;h3&amp;gt;1. Create a new database&amp;lt;/h3&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;!-- Form to create a database --&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;form id=&amp;quot;databaseForm&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
              &amp;lt;label for=&amp;quot;dbName&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Database name&amp;lt;/label&amp;gt;
              &amp;lt;input type=&amp;quot;text&amp;quot; id=&amp;quot;dbName&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
              &amp;lt;input type=&amp;quot;submit&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;!-- Empty table cell to append the API response to --&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;td id=&amp;quot;dbResponse&amp;quot;&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;
        ...
      &amp;lt;/table&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;/main&amp;gt;
    ...
  &amp;lt;/body&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;/html&amp;gt;

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In terms of what‚Äôs rendered in the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;body&amp;gt;&lt;/code&gt;, notice the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;form&amp;gt;&lt;/code&gt; element and an empty table cell with the ID &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;dbResponse&lt;/code&gt;. The latter is where we‚Äôll append the Notion API response information.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The database form includes two inputs:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A text input for the database name&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A submit input to submit the form&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Also of note: the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;client.js&lt;/code&gt; file is included in the document‚Äôs &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;head&amp;gt;&lt;/code&gt; tag, which allows us to apply client-side JavaScript to interact with these HTML elements.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;step-2-handling-the-form-submission--clientjs&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-step-2-handling-the-form-submission-client-js&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Step 2: Handling the form submission  (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;client.js&lt;/code&gt;)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Step 2: Handling the form submission  (&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#step-2-handling-the-form-submission--clientjs&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;client.js&lt;/code&gt;, we can write a function to describe what should happen when the database form is submitted. In short, we want to make a request to &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.js&lt;/code&gt; to then make an API request to Notion. The actual Notion API request will happen server-side to avoid exposing our API secret in the client. (In other words, it‚Äôs more secure!)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSX&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-jsx theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;jsx&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;// Assign the database form to a variable for later use
const dbForm = document.getElementById(&amp;quot;databaseForm&amp;quot;);
// Assign the empty table cell to a variable for later use
const dbResponseEl = document.getElementById(&amp;quot;dbResponse&amp;quot;);

// Add a submit handler to the form
dbForm.onsubmit = async function (event) {
  event.preventDefault()

// Get the database name from the form
  const dbName = event.target.dbName.value
  const body = JSON.stringify({ dbName })

// Make a request to /databases endpoint in server.js
  const newDBResponse = await fetch(&amp;quot;/databases&amp;quot;, {
    method: &amp;quot;POST&amp;quot;,
    headers: {
      &amp;quot;Content-Type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;application/json&amp;quot;,
    },
    body,
  })
  const newDBData = await newDBResponse.json()

// Pass the new database info and the empty table cell
// to a function that will append it.
  appendApiResponse(newDBData, dbResponseEl)
}

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In this code block, we select the form element using its ID attribute with &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;getElementbyId()&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Next, we attach an async function to the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;onsubmit&lt;/code&gt; event that will make a request to our local server‚Äôs &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;/databases&lt;/code&gt; endpoint. (This endpoint will be described below in our &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.js&lt;/code&gt; code.) The function is asynchronous because we need to wait for a response from our server before proceeding.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The response is then appended to our &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;index.html&lt;/code&gt; document. (&lt;a href=&quot;#step-5-displaying-the-response-indexhtml&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;More on this below.&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;step-3-importing-the-notion-sdk-serverts&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-step-3-importing-the-notion-sdk-server-ts&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Step 3: Importing the Notion SDK (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.ts&lt;/code&gt;)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Step 3: Importing the Notion SDK (&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#step-3-importing-the-notion-sdk-serverts&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Let&amp;#x27;s start by looking at our &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.ts&lt;/code&gt; file without the Notion-related endpoints:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSON&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;json&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;require(&amp;quot;dotenv&amp;quot;).config();
const express = require(&amp;quot;express&amp;quot;);
const app = express();

// Notion SDK for JavaScript
const { Client } = require(&amp;quot;@notionhq/client&amp;quot;);
const notion = new Client({ auth: process.env.NOTION_KEY });

// &amp;lt;http://expressjs.com/en/starter/static-files.html&amp;gt;
app.use(express.static(&amp;quot;public&amp;quot;));

// &amp;lt;http://expressjs.com/en/starter/basic-routing.html&amp;gt;
app.get(&amp;quot;/&amp;quot;, function(request, response) {
  response.sendFile(__dirname + &amp;quot;/views/index.html&amp;quot;);
});

// listen for requests
const listener = app.listen(process.env.PORT, function() {
  console.log(&amp;quot;Your app is listening on port &amp;quot; + listener.address().port);
});

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This Express.js code will listen for requests to &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;/&lt;/code&gt; (e.g., &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;localhost:&amp;lt;port&amp;gt;/&lt;/code&gt;) and respond with the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;index.html&lt;/code&gt; file. That‚Äôs how the app knows to render our &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;index.html&lt;/code&gt; code when the server is started.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To use the SDK, we import it at the top of &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.ts&lt;/code&gt;. We also initialize a new Notion Client instance and set the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;auth&lt;/code&gt; option to the Notion API secret already set in the environment variables:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSX&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-jsx theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;jsx&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;const { Client } = require(&amp;quot;@notionhq/client&amp;quot;);
const notion = new Client({ auth: process.env.NOTION_KEY });

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;We can now make requests to Notion‚Äôs API in this file without having to worry about authentication again.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;step-4-handling-the-forms-post-request-serverts&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-step-4-handling-the-forms-post-request-server-ts&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Step 4: Handling the form‚Äôs POST request (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.ts&lt;/code&gt;)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Step 4: Handling the form‚Äôs POST request (&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#step-4-handling-the-forms-post-request-serverts&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Staying in &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.ts&lt;/code&gt;, we can add the following code that will be invoked when the database form makes a POST request to &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;/databases&lt;/code&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;TypeScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-typescript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;typescript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;app.post(&amp;quot;/databases&amp;quot;, async function (request, response) {
  const pageId = process.env.NOTION_PAGE_ID;
  const title = request.body.dbName;

  try {
    // Notion API request!
    const newDb = await notion.databases.create({
      parent: {
        type: &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;,
        page_id: pageId,
      },
      title: [
        {
          type: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,
          text: {
            content: title,
          },
        },
      ],
      initial_data_source: {
        properties: {
          Name: {
            title: {},
          },
        },
      },
    });
    response.json({ message: &amp;quot;success!&amp;quot;, data: newDb });
  } catch (error) {
    response.json({ message: &amp;quot;error&amp;quot;, error });
  }
});
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;app.post()&lt;/code&gt; indicates this endpoint is for POST requests, and the first argument (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;/databases&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;) indicates this function corresponds to requests made to the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;/databases&lt;/code&gt; path, as we did in our client-side code above.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Next, we can actually interact with the Notion API.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To create a new database with one data source, we‚Äôll use the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Create a database&lt;/a&gt; endpoint:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;TypeScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-typescript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;typescript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;await notion.databases.create({...options})

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To use this endpoint, we need to pass the parent page ID in the body parameters. This page ID is the one already set in the environment variables. The page ID &lt;strong&gt;must&lt;/strong&gt; be included in this request.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;TypeScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-typescript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;typescript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;const pageId = process.env.NOTION_PAGE_ID;
...
try {
  const newDb = await notion.databases.create({
    parent: {
      type: &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;,
      page_id: pageId,
    },
		...

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;(Note: Environment variables can only be accessed in &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;server.js&lt;/code&gt; , not &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;client.js&lt;/code&gt;.)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In this example, the title of the database should also be set. The title was provided in the form the user submitted, which we can access from the request‚Äôs body (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;request.body.dbName&lt;/code&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;TypeScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-typescript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;typescript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;  const pageId = process.env.NOTION_PAGE_ID;
  const title = request.body.dbName; // Get the user&amp;#x27;s title

  try {
    const newDb = await notion.databases.create({
      parent: {...},
      title: [
        {
          type: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,
          text: {
            content: title, // Include the user&amp;#x27;s title in the request
          },
        },
      ],
      // ...
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Finally, we need to describe the &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/property-object&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;data source&amp;#x27;s properties&lt;/a&gt;. The properties represent the columns in a data source (or the ‚Äúschema‚Äù, depending on which terminology you prefer.)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In this case, our data source will have just one column called ‚ÄúName‚Äù, which will represent the page names of its child pages:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;TypeScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-typescript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;typescript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;try {
    const newDb = await notion.databases.create({
      parent: {...},
      title: [...],
      properties: {
        Name: {
          title: {},
        },
      },
    })
...

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Finally, assuming the request works, we can return the response from Notion‚Äôs API back to our original fetch request in &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;client.js&lt;/code&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JavaScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;javascript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;...
response.json({ message: &amp;quot;success!&amp;quot;, data: newDb });

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;If it doesn‚Äôt work, we‚Äôll return whatever error message we get from Notion‚Äôs API:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JavaScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;javascript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;try {
...
} catch (error) {
  response.json({ message: &amp;quot;error&amp;quot;, error });
}

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Now that we have our new database, the response can be added to the HTML document via the client-side JavaScript (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;client.js&lt;/code&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;step-5-displaying-the-response-indexhtml&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-step-5-displaying-the-response-index-html&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Step 5: Displaying the response (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;index.html&lt;/code&gt;)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Step 5: Displaying the response (&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#step-5-displaying-the-response-indexhtml&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Let‚Äôs first look at an example of the object the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;/databases&lt;/code&gt; endpoint responds with, which includes the &lt;a href=&quot;&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;object&lt;/a&gt; that gets returned from the Notion API when we create a new database:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;Response&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;javascript&quot; name=&quot;Response&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;{
  message: &amp;quot;success!&amp;quot;,
  data: { // from Notion
    object: &amp;quot;database&amp;quot;,
    id: &amp;quot;e604f78c-4145-4444-b7d5-1adea4fa5d08&amp;quot;,
    cover: null,
    icon: null,
    created_time: &amp;quot;2023-07-18T20:56:00.000Z&amp;quot;,
    created_by: { object: &amp;quot;user&amp;quot;, id: &amp;quot;44b170f0-16ac-47cf-aaaa-8f2eab66hhhh&amp;quot; },
    last_edited_by: {
      object: &amp;quot;user&amp;quot;,
      id: &amp;quot;44b170f0-16ac-47cf-gggg-8f2eab6rrrra&amp;quot;,
    },
    last_edited_time: &amp;quot;2023-07-18T20:56:00.000Z&amp;quot;,
    title: [
      {
        type: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,
        text: [Object],
        annotations: [Object],
        plain_text: &amp;quot;test db&amp;quot;,
        href: null
      },
    ],
    description: [],
    is_inline: false,
    data_sources: [
      {
        id: &amp;quot;a2216f7f-574f-4ae7-8df9-9eb8a65ec62d&amp;quot;,
        name: &amp;quot;...&amp;quot;
      }
    ],
    parent: {
      type: &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;,
      page_id: &amp;quot;e7261079-9d30-4313-9999-14b29880gggg&amp;quot;,
    },
    url: &amp;quot;&amp;lt;https://www.notion.so/e604f78c414548c6b7d51adea4fadddd&amp;gt;&amp;quot;,
    public_url: null,
    archived: false,
    in_trash: false
  },
}

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The most important information here (for our purposes) is the data source ID (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;data.data_sources[0].id&lt;/code&gt;). The ID will be required to make API requests to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Create a page&lt;/a&gt; endpoint, which is the next form in our completed demo‚Äôs UI.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Knowing this JSON structure, let‚Äôs now look at how &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;appendApiResponse()&lt;/code&gt; works:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSX&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-jsx theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;jsx&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;const dbForm = document.getElementById(&amp;quot;databaseForm&amp;quot;);
// Empty table cell where we&amp;#x27;ll display the API response
const dbResponse = document.getElementById(&amp;quot;dbResponse&amp;quot;);
...

// Appends the API response to the UI
const appendApiResponse = function (apiResponse, el) {
  // Add success message to UI
  const newParagraphSuccessMsg = document.createElement(&amp;quot;p&amp;quot;)
  newParagraphSuccessMsg.innerHTML = &amp;quot;Result: &amp;quot; + apiResponse.message
  el.appendChild(newParagraphSuccessMsg)

  // See browser console for more information if there&amp;#x27;s an error
  if (apiResponse.message === &amp;quot;error&amp;quot;) return

  // Add ID of Notion item (db, page, comment) to UI
  const newParagraphId = document.createElement(&amp;quot;p&amp;quot;)
  newParagraphId.innerHTML = &amp;quot;ID: &amp;quot; + apiResponse.data.id
  if (&amp;quot;data_sources&amp;quot; in apiResponse.data) {
    // Include the initial data source ID for database responses.
    // Pages must identify which data source under a database they live under.
    newParagraphId.innerHTML += &amp;quot;; Data Source ID: &amp;quot; + apiResponse.data.data_sources[0].id
  }
  el.appendChild(newParagraphId)

  // Add URL of Notion item (db, page) to UI
  if (apiResponse.data.url) {
    const newAnchorTag = document.createElement(&amp;quot;a&amp;quot;)
    newAnchorTag.setAttribute(&amp;quot;href&amp;quot;, apiResponse.data.url)
    newAnchorTag.innerText = apiResponse.data.url
    el.appendChild(newAnchorTag)
  }
}

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;appendApiResponse(res, form)&lt;/code&gt; accepts two parameters: the response (shown above) and the HTML element where we will append the response ‚Äî in this case, an empty table cell next to the database form.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In this function, we first add a paragraph element to show the response message (i.e., whether it was a success or the error).&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSX&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-jsx theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;jsx&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;const newParagraphSuccessMsg = document.createElement(&amp;quot;p&amp;quot;)
newParagraphSuccessMsg.innerHTML = &amp;quot;Result: &amp;quot; + apiResponse.message
el.appendChild(newParagraphSuccessMsg)

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Then, we do the same with the database ID &amp;amp; data source ID after confirming the response was not an error:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSX&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-jsx theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;jsx&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;  if (apiResponse.message === &amp;quot;error&amp;quot;) return

  // Add ID of database and data source to UI
  const newParagraphId = document.createElement(&amp;quot;p&amp;quot;)
  newParagraphId.innerHTML = &amp;quot;Database ID: &amp;quot; + \
    apiResponse.data.id + &amp;quot;; Data Source ID&amp;quot; + apiResponse.data.data_sources[0].id
  el.appendChild(newParagraphId)

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Finally, if the response has a URL, we display that too with an anchor (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;lt;a&amp;gt;&lt;/code&gt;) tag. This allows the user to visit the database directly in Notion.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSX&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-jsx theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;jsx&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;  if (apiResponse.data.url) {
    const newAnchorTag = document.createElement(&amp;quot;a&amp;quot;)
    newAnchorTag.setAttribute(&amp;quot;href&amp;quot;, apiResponse.data.url)
    newAnchorTag.innerText = apiResponse.data.url
    el.appendChild(newAnchorTag)
  }

&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;(Note: This function will be reused by other forms. Not all responses have a &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;url&lt;/code&gt; property, which is why we check for it.)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Once this is done, our HTML document is updated and the form submission is officially complete.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;testing-the-feature&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-testing-the-feature&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Testing the feature&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Testing the feature&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#testing-the-feature&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Let‚Äôs see the final results of testing this new feature:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;figure&gt;&lt;span aria-label=&quot;Submitting the database form and visiting the Notion URL from the response.&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;Submitting the database form and visiting the Notion URL from the response.&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/e58e2ed-newdb.gif&quot; title=&quot;&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; width=&quot;auto&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;figcaption&gt;&lt;p&gt;Submitting the database form and visiting the Notion URL from the response.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/figcaption&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The database form is submitted and the response from Notion&amp;#x27;s API is appended to our UI. üéâ We can click the link to visit the new database in Notion and confirm it worked as expected. &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;As a next step, the new data source ID can be copy and pasted into the page form below it to create a new page in the data source. We can also use the page ID that the page form returns to add content to the page or comment on it using the block and comment forms.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;We won‚Äôt cover the code for page, blocks, or comment forms here, but the code is all included in the &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/blob/main/examples/web-form-with-express/views/index.html&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;source code&lt;/a&gt; for reference. It works the same as the database example.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;As a next step, you could also try adding a feature to &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;retrieve all existing pages&lt;/a&gt; in the data source, or &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/get-block-children&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;retrieve block children&lt;/a&gt; (i.e., page content) for an existing page.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;hr/&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;wrapping-up&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-wrapping-up&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Wrapping up&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Wrapping up&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#wrapping-up&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This guide demonstrated how to use Notion‚Äôs API (via the &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt;) to build an internal integration. With this demo app, users can programmatically create a new database in their Notion workspace by filling out a form in the app UI and making a request to Notion‚Äôs public API ‚Äî the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Create a database&lt;/a&gt; endpoint.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;As a reminder, this example includes client-side code to allow for user interactions via a GUI (graphical user interface). Notion integrations do not require a UI, however. What you build is completely up to you!&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To see examples of server-side-only integrations, test out the sample apps in the SDK‚Äôs &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;GitHub repo&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;next-steps&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-next-steps&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Next steps&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Next steps&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#next-steps&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To learn more about authorizing API requests or to learn how to add an auth flow to your public integration, read the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Authorization guide&lt;/a&gt; next.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;additional-resources&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-additional-resources&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Additional resources&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Additional resources&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#additional-resources&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Reference documentation&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;JavaScript client&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://www.postman.com/notionhq/&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Postman collection&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-typescript-starter&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;TypeScript starter template&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/page/frequently-asked-questions&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;FAQs&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://join.slack.com/t/notiondevs/shared_invite/zt-20b5996xv-DzJdLiympy6jP0GGzu3AMg&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Slack developer community&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;" style="margin-left:31px" class="rm-Markdown markdown-body rm-Markdown markdown-body ng-non-bindable" data-testid="RDMD"><h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="integration-overview"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-integration-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Integration overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Integration overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#integration-overview"></a></h2>
<p>In this guide, we‚Äôre going to build an <a target="_self" href="/docs/getting-started#internal-integrations">internal Notion integration</a> that can create a new database in your Notion workspace via a web form.</p>
<figure><span aria-label="Demo web app that creates new databases in your Notion workspace." class="img lightbox closed" role="button" tabindex="0"><span class="lightbox-inner"><img alt="Demo web app that creates new databases in your Notion workspace." loading="lazy" src="https://files.readme.io/55d7b4b-dbform.png" title="" align="center" class="border" caption="" height="auto" width="auto"/></span></span><figcaption><p>Demo web app that creates new databases in your Notion workspace.</p></figcaption></figure>
<p>Internal integrations are a good entry point to building integrations because they have a simpler <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization">authorization</a> flow than <a target="_self" href="/docs/getting-started#public-integrations">public integrations</a>.</p>
<p>Before diving in, let‚Äôs quickly review Notion integrations. Integrations define how the public API can programmatically interact with your Notion workspace. They need to be authorized (i.e., given explicit permission) to make any changes your workspace.</p>
<p>All integration types use Notion‚Äôs public API to make requests to update a Notion workspace. The specific use case for each integration can vary greatly, from using Notion as a CMS for a blog, to <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/notion-github-sync">tracking Github issues</a>, to <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/database-email-update">sending emails</a> in response to Notion changes.</p>
<p>This guide is just one introductory example of what you can build with Notion‚Äôs public API.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="todays-goals"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-todays-goals" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Today‚Äôs goals</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Today‚Äôs goals" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#todays-goals"></a></h2>
<p>This guide will demonstrate how to build an HTML form that will <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-database">create a new Notion database</a> when submitted.</p>
<p>By the end of this guide, we‚Äôll have a functional app that looks like this:</p>
<figure><span aria-label="Database form UI." class="img lightbox closed" role="button" tabindex="0"><span class="lightbox-inner"><img alt="Database form UI." loading="lazy" src="https://files.readme.io/36a22d6-dbform.png" title="" align="center" class="border" caption="" height="auto" width="auto"/></span></span><figcaption><p>Database form UI.</p></figcaption></figure>
<p>The completed <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/web-form-with-express">sample code</a> includes additional examples beyond what‚Äôs covered in this guide, including forms to:</p>
<ul>
<li><a target="_self" href="/reference/post-page">Add a new page</a> to the database</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/reference/patch-block-children">Add content</a> to the new page</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-comment">Add a comment</a> to the page content</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="requirements"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-requirements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Requirements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Requirements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#requirements"></a></h3>
<p>To follow along with this guide, you will need:</p>
<ul>
<li>A¬†<a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/signup">Notion account</a>.</li>
<li>To be a <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/help/add-members-admins-guests-and-groups">Workspace Owner</a>¬†in the workspace you‚Äôre using. You can create a new workspace for testing purposes otherwise.</li>
<li>Knowledge of HTML and JavaScript. We‚Äôll use <a target="_self" href="https://expressjs.com/">Express.js</a> for a server, as well.</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="https://docs.npmjs.com/downloading-and-installing-node-js-and-npm">npm and Node.js</a>¬†installed locally to use the¬†<a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js">Notion SDK for JavaScript</a> and <a target="_self" href="https://expressjs.com/">Express.js</a></li>
</ul>
